data.title: Shaft's Carnival of Killers by Tidyman, Ernest: Good Mass Market Paperback (1974) First Edition
data.meta_description: First Edition - Mass Market Paperback - Bantam Books, Inc., New York - 1974 - Condition: Good - Paperback Original. UK price stamped to top left corner of front cover. The spine has some reading creasing, browning and rubbing along the edges. Reading creases down the left hand edge of the front cover and the right hand edge of the rear cover next to the spine. Light edge wear to covers with two two inch long vertical creases to the bottom right corner of the front cover and a lighter vertical crease down the centre. Pages a little browned around the edges with this title circled in ink on the list of titles and a two inch closed tear to the edge of the first page of the text but the pages are otherwise unmarked. First printing. - Shaft's Carnival of Killers
data.text:
Shipping Terms:

Orders usually ship within 2 business days.

UK Orders: Shipping costs are based on books weighing 2.2 lb, or 1 kg. If your book order is heavy or oversized, we may contact you to let you know extra shipping is required. If you are buying a small paperback or another small book then the postage and packing will generally be reduced by £1.50 and I will reduce the charge before processing your order.

European Orders: Shipping costs are based on books weighing 800g. For European orders I have only quoted a price for air mail. Not all European countries have been added so your shipping may appear high. Please note that I will adjust the charge I make if this is the case and postage to Europe will be lower than the rest of the world. If you are buying a small paperback or another small book then the postage and packing will generally be reduced by £1.50 and I will reduce the charge before processing your order.

Other overseas orders: shipping costs are based on books weighing 800g. I will generally use whatever method is covered by the standard postage charge but if you specifically wish to have it sent surface or airmail or anything else please ask and I will amend the charge accordingly. Please only choose the cheaper surface mail option if you do not mind waiting - the suggested upper time limit for this form of delivery is 60 days and it can take that long - and sometimes a bit longer. If therefore you wish to receive the book in 2-3 weeks then please opt for the more expensive postage option which will guarantee airmail delivery. If you are buying a small paperback or another small book then the postage and packing will generally be reduced by £1.50 and I will reduce the charge before processing your order.

Books are usually wrapped in bubblewrap and then in cardboard. Please ask if you have any particular requirements.
